items.name: Anomalous HTTP Response Codes
items.value: _path=="http" AND status_code >= 400 | count() by status_code | sort -r
items.description: Shows the count of HTTP response codes that indicate errors (400 and above)

items.name: Identify Outbound Traffic to Known Malicious File Sharing Services
items.value: _path=="conn" AND id.resp_h in (list of known malicious file sharing service domains) | count() by id.orig_h | sort -r
items.description: Detects outbound network traffic to domains associated with known malicious file sharing services

items.name: HTTP Traffic by Content Type
items.value: _path=="http" | count() by mime_type | sort -r
items.description: Displays HTTP traffic distribution by MIME content types

items.name: HTTP Responses with Large Payloads
items.value: _path=="http" AND resp_size > 10MB | count() by uri | sort -r
items.description: Detects HTTP responses with large payloads

items.name: Identify Outbound HTTP Traffic to Suspicious IP Addresses
items.value: _path=="http" AND id.resp_h in ("malicious_ip1", "malicious_ip2", "malicious_ip3") | count() by id.resp_h | sort -r
items.description: Detects outbound HTTP traffic to known malicious IP addresses

items.name: Identify HTTP Response Status Codes for Redirects
items.value: _path=="http" AND status_code =~ /^3/ | count() by status_code | sort -r
items.description: Detects HTTP responses with status codes indicating redirects

items.name: Unusual Protocol Combinations
items.value: _path=="conn" | count() by proto | sort -r | filter proto not in ("tcp", "udp", "icmp")
items.description: Identifies unusual protocol combinations in network traffic

items.name: Identify Short-Lived Network Connections
items.value: _path=="conn" | put connection_duration := ts - orig_ts | filter connection_duration < 60 | count() by id.orig_h, id.resp_h | sort -r
items.description: Detects short-lived network connections lasting less than 1 minute

items.name: Identify Long-Lived Network Connections
items.value: _path=="conn" | put connection_duration := ts - orig_ts | filter connection_duration > 3600 | count() by id.orig_h, id.resp_h | sort -r
items.description: Detects long-lived network connections lasting more than 1 hour

items.name: Top SMTP Senders
items.value: _path=="smtp" | count() by id.orig_h | sort -r
items.description: Shows the IP addresses sending the most SMTP traffic

items.name: SMTP Traffic by Email Sender
items.value: _path=="smtp" | count() by id.orig_h | sort -r
items.description: Shows SMTP traffic distribution by email sender

items.name: Identify Outbound SMTP Traffic to Unusual Domains
items.value: _path=="smtp" AND mailfrom=="" AND NOT (domain=="gmail.com" OR domain=="yahoo.com" OR domain=="hotmail.com") | count() by domain | sort -r
items.description: Identifies outbound SMTP traffic to domains not commonly associated with personal email services

items.name: Large Outbound Email Attachments
items.value: _path=="smtp" AND attachment.size > 10MB | count() by id.orig_h | sort -r
items.description: Identifies SMTP traffic with large outbound email attachments

items.name: SMTP Traffic Analysis
items.value: _path=="smtp" | count() by command | sort -r
items.description: Analyzes SMTP commands to understand SMTP traffic patterns

items.name: SMTP Traffic Analysis by Sender Domain
items.value: _path=="smtp" | cut mailfrom | split(mailfrom,"@") | count() by split_result[1] | sort -r
items.description: Analyzes SMTP traffic by sender domain to identify traffic sources

items.name: Identify SMB/CIFS Traffic Patterns
items.value: _path=="smb_files" OR _path=="smb_mapping" | count() by command | sort -r
items.description: Analyzes SMB/CIFS traffic patterns to identify common commands used in file sharing

items.name: Potential DDoS Attack Detection
items.value: _path=="conn" | count() by id.resp_h | sort -r | filter count > 1000
items.description: Identifies potential DDoS targets by looking for IPs with a high number of connections

items.name: Unauthorized SSH Access Attempts
items.value: _path=="ssh" AND auth_success=="F" | count() by id.orig_h | sort -r
items.description: Displays failed SSH access attempts to identify potential brute force attacks

items.name: Suspicious HTTP User-Agents
items.value: _path=="http" | count() by user_agent | sort -r | filter user_agent =~ /.*(curl|wget|python|java|libwww|httpclient).*/
items.description: Identifies HTTP User-Agents that are commonly used by automated tools and scripts

items.name: Unusual User-Agent Strings in HTTP Requests
items.value: _path=="http" | filter user_agent !in ("Mozilla", "Chrome", "Firefox", "Safari", "Edge") | count() by user_agent | sort -r
items.description: Identifies uncommon or suspicious User-Agent strings in HTTP requests

items.name: Identify Outbound Traffic Using Rare User-Agent Strings
items.value: _path=="http" | count() by user_agent | sort -r
items.description: Detects outbound HTTP traffic with uncommon User-Agent strings, which may indicate non-standard or malicious behavior

items.name: DNS Tunneling Detection
items.value: _path=="dns" | filter query_length > 50 | count() by query | sort -r
items.description: Detects potential DNS tunneling by looking for unusually long DNS queries

items.name: DNS Tunneling Detection (NXDOMAIN)
items.value: _path=="dns" AND rcode=="NXDOMAIN" | count() by query | sort -r
items.description: Identifies potential DNS tunneling through NXDOMAIN responses

items.name: DNS Queries for Newly Observed Domains
items.value: _path=="dns" | cut query | uniq -c | filter count < 5
items.description: Identifies DNS queries for domains that have been observed less than 5 times

items.name: Identify Potential DNS Amplification Attacks
items.value: _path=="dns" AND qtype=="ANY" AND rcode=="NOERROR" AND rlength > 512 | count() by id.orig_h | sort -r
items.description: Detects potential DNS amplification attacks based on unusually large responses to ANY queries

items.name: Identify Potential DNS Amplification Attacks
items.value: _path=="dns" AND qtype=="ANY" AND rcode=="NOERROR" AND rlength > 512 | count() by id.orig_h | sort -r
items.description: Detects potential DNS amplification attacks based on unusually large responses to ANY queries

items.name: Identify Large DNS Responses
items.value: _path=="dns" AND rlength > 512 | count() by query | sort -r
items.description: Detects DNS responses exceeding the typical limit of 512 bytes

items.name: Identify Outbound Traffic Using Non-Standard DNS Ports
items.value: _path=="dns" AND id.resp_p not in (list of standard DNS ports) | count() by id.orig_h | sort -r
items.description: Detects outbound DNS traffic using non-standard DNS ports

items.name: Identify Outbound DNS Queries to Suspicious TLDs
items.value: _path=="dns" AND query_root_domain in (".tk", ".xyz", ".pw", ".top") | count() by query | sort -r
items.description: Detects outbound DNS queries to suspicious top-level domains

items.name: Identify Outbound DNS Traffic to Known Malicious Domains
items.value: _path=="dns" AND query in (list of known malicious domains) | count() by query | sort -r
items.description: Detects outbound DNS queries to domains known to be associated with malicious activity

items.name: Identify DNS Responses with Uncommon Resource Record Types
items.value: _path=="dns" AND !qtype in (list of common DNS record types) | count() by qtype | sort -r
items.description: Detects DNS responses containing uncommon resource record types

items.name: Identify Outbound Traffic to Dynamic DNS (DDNS) Domains
items.value: _path=="conn" AND id.resp_h in (list of known DDNS domains) | count() by id.orig_h | sort -r
items.description: Detects outbound network traffic to domains associated with Dynamic DNS services

items.name: Insecure Protocols
items.value: _path=="conn" AND proto in ("ftp", "telnet", "http") | count() by proto | sort -r
items.description: Identifies the use of insecure protocols such as FTP, Telnet, and HTTP

items.name: High-Risk IP Addresses
items.value: _path=="intel" AND seen.where=="remote" | count() by seen.addr | sort -r
items.description: Lists high-risk IP addresses detected by the threat intelligence framework

items.name: Connections to Known Malicious IPs
items.value: _path=="conn" AND intel.hit=="T" | cut id.orig_h, id.resp_h, service, proto | uniq
items.description: Shows connections to IP addresses flagged by threat intelligence sources

items.name: Top Network Services
items.value: _path=="conn" | count() by service | sort -r
items.description: Displays the most frequently used network services

items.name: Unusual DNS Query Patterns
items.value: _path=="dns" | cut query | count() by query | sort -r | filter count < 5
items.description: Identifies unusual DNS query patterns with low occurrence

items.name: SSH Brute Force Attempts
items.value: _path=="ssh" AND auth_attempts >= 3 | count() by id.orig_h | sort -r
items.description: Detects SSH brute force attempts with multiple authentication failures

items.name: SSH Traffic Analysis
items.value: _path=="ssh" | count() by command | sort -r
items.description: Analyzes SSH commands to understand SSH traffic patterns

items.name: Identify Outbound SSH Connections to Unusual Ports
items.value: _path=="ssh" AND id.resp_p not in (22, 2222) | count() by id.resp_p | sort -r
items.description: Detects outbound SSH connections to ports other than the standard SSH ports (22, 2222)

items.name: SSL/TLS Certificate Expiry Analysis
items.value: _path=="ssl" | cut id.resp_h, subject, issuer, valid_from, valid_until | sort valid_until
items.description: Analyzes SSL/TLS certificate validity periods to identify potential expirations

items.name: Identify Unusual SSL/TLS Handshake Patterns
items.value: _path=="ssl" | count() by version, cipher | sort -r
items.description: Analyzes SSL/TLS handshake patterns to identify unusual combinations of protocol versions and cipher suites

items.name: Identify SSL/TLS Handshakes with Self-Signed Certificates
items.value: _path=="ssl" AND certificate_chain_fuids == "-" | count() by id.orig_h | sort -r
items.description: Detects SSL/TLS handshakes using self-signed certificates

items.name: FTP Activity Analysis
items.value: _path=="ftp" | count() by command | sort -r
items.description: Analyzes FTP commands to identify FTP activity patterns

items.name: FTP Uploads with Suspicious File Extensions
items.value: _path=="ftp" AND command=="put" | filter arg !in (".txt", ".pdf", ".doc", ".xls") | count() by arg | sort -r
items.description: Identifies FTP uploads with suspicious file extensions

items.name: FTP Login Attempts with Invalid Credentials
items.value: _path=="ftp" AND reply_code==530 | count() by user | sort -r
items.description: Identifies FTP login attempts with invalid credentials

items.name: IRC Traffic Analysis
items.value: _path=="irc" | count() by command | sort -r
items.description: Analyzes IRC (Internet Relay Chat) traffic commands

items.name: VoIP Traffic Analysis
items.value: _path=="sip" | count() by method | sort -r
items.description: Analyzes Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) traffic methods in VoIP communication

items.name: ICMP Echo (Ping) Requests Analysis
items.value: _path=="icmp" AND icmp_type==8 | count() by id.orig_h | sort -r
items.description: Identifies hosts generating ICMP echo (ping) requests

items.name: Identify Large ICMP Echo (Ping) Requests
items.value: _path=="icmp" AND icmp_type==8 AND icmp_code==0 AND size > 1024 | count() by id.orig_h | sort -r
items.description: Detects ICMP echo (ping) requests larger than 1 KB

items.name: Unencrypted Traffic Analysis
items.value: _path=="conn" AND NOT (proto=="ssl" OR proto=="tls") | count() by proto | sort -r
items.description: Detects unencrypted network traffic by excluding SSL/TLS connections

items.name: Identify SQL Injection Attempts in HTTP Requests
items.value: _path=="http" AND uri =~ /.*(sql|xss|injection|select|union|exec).*/ | count() by id.orig_h | sort -r
items.description: Detects HTTP requests containing common SQL injection keywords

items.name: Identify Outbound UDP Traffic to Unusual Ports
items.value: _path=="conn" AND proto=="udp" AND id.orig_p not in (53, 123, 161) | count() by id.orig_p | sort -r
items.description: Detects outbound UDP traffic to ports other than commonly used UDP ports (DNS, NTP, SNMP)

items.name: Identify Outbound Traffic to Tor Exit Nodes
items.value: _path=="conn" AND id.resp_h in (list of Tor exit node IP addresses) | count() by id.orig_h | sort -r
items.description: Detects outbound network traffic to IP addresses associated with Tor exit nodes

items.name: Identify Outbound Traffic on Non-Standard Ports
items.value: _path=="conn" AND id.resp_p not in (list of commonly used ports) | count() by id.orig_h | sort -r
items.description: Detects outbound network traffic on ports that are not commonly used

items.name: Identify Outbound Traffic to IP Addresses with Low Reputation Scores
items.value: _path=="conn" AND id.resp_h in (list of IP addresses with low reputation scores) | count() by id.orig_h | sort -r
items.description: Detects outbound network traffic to IP addresses with low reputation scores

items.name: Identify Outbound Traffic to High-Risk Countries
items.value: _path=="conn" AND id.resp_geo.country_code in (list of high-risk country codes) | count() by id.orig_h | sort -r
items.description: Detects outbound network traffic to countries known for malicious activity

items.name: Identify Outbound Traffic on Uncommon Protocols
items.value: _path=="conn" AND proto not in (list of common protocols) | count() by proto | sort -r
items.description: Detects outbound network traffic on protocols that are not commonly used

items.name: Identify Outbound Traffic to Newly Registered Domains (NRDs)
items.value: _path=="conn" AND id.resp_h in (list of newly registered domains) | count() by id.orig_h | sort -r
items.description: Detects outbound network traffic to domains registered recently, which may indicate suspicious activity

items.name: Identify Outbound Traffic to Sinkhole Addresses
items.value: _path=="conn" AND id.resp_h in (list of known sinkhole addresses) | count() by id.orig_h | sort -r
items.description: Detects outbound network traffic to IP addresses designated as sinkholes for malicious traffic

items.name: Identify Outbound Traffic to High-Entropy Domains
items.value: _path=="conn" AND entropy(id.resp_h) > 4 | count() by id.orig_h | sort -r
items.description: Detects outbound network traffic to domains with high entropy, which may indicate domain generation algorithms (DGAs) or fast flux networks

items.name: Identify Outbound Traffic to Suspicious Tor Hidden Services
items.value: _path=="conn" AND id.resp_h in (list of suspicious Tor hidden service addresses) | count() by id.orig_h | sort -r
items.description: Detects outbound network traffic to Tor hidden services that may be associated with malicious activities

items.name: Identify Outbound Traffic to Command and Control (C2) Servers
items.value: _path=="conn" AND id.resp_h in (list of known C2 server IP addresses) | count() by id.orig_h | sort -r
items.description: Detects outbound network traffic to IP addresses associated with command and control servers

items.name: Identify Outbound Traffic to Known Malware C2 Domains
items.value: _path=="conn" AND id.resp_h in (list of known malware C2 domains) | count() by id.orig_h | sort -r
items.description: Detects outbound network traffic to domains known to be associated with malware command and control servers

items.name: Identify Outbound Traffic to Phishing URLs
items.value: _path=="http" AND (uri in (list of known phishing URLs) OR host in (list of known phishing domains)) | count() by id.orig_h | sort -r
items.description: Detects outbound HTTP traffic to URLs or domains associated with known phishing attempts

items.name: Identify Outbound Traffic to Tor Relays
items.value: _path=="conn" AND id.resp_h in (list of Tor relay IP addresses) | count() by id.orig_h | sort -r
items.description: Detects outbound network traffic to IP addresses associated with Tor relays

items.name: Identify Outbound Traffic to Suspicious Protocol Handlers
items.value: _path=="conn" AND id.resp_p in (list of suspicious protocol handlers) | count() by id.orig_h | sort -r
items.description: Detects outbound network traffic to destinations associated with suspicious protocol handlers (e.g., irc, bitcoin)

items.name: Identify Outbound Traffic to Domain Generation Algorithms (DGAs)
items.value: _path=="dns" AND query in (list of known DGA patterns) | count() by id.orig_h | sort -r
items.description: Detects outbound DNS queries matching known patterns of Domain Generation Algorithms (DGAs), often indicative of malware communication

items.name: Identify Outbound Traffic to Cryptocurrency Mining Pools
items.value: _path=="conn" AND id.resp_h in (list of known cryptocurrency mining pool domains) | count() by id.orig_h | sort -r
items.description: Detects outbound network traffic to domains associated with cryptocurrency mining pools

items.name: Identify Outbound Traffic to Anonymizing Proxies and VPN Services
items.value: _path=="conn" AND id.resp_h in (list of known anonymizing proxy and VPN IP addresses) | count() by id.orig_h | sort -r
items.description: Detects outbound network traffic to IP addresses associated with anonymizing proxy and VPN services

items.name: Identify Outbound Traffic to Blacklisted Domains
items.value: _path=="http" AND host in (list of blacklisted domains) | count() by id.orig_h | sort -r
items.description: Detects outbound HTTP traffic to domains listed in blacklists or threat intelligence feeds

items.name: Identify Outbound Traffic Using Suspicious URI Patterns
items.value: _path=="http" AND uri in (list of suspicious URI patterns) | count() by id.orig_h | sort -r
items.description: Detects outbound HTTP traffic with URIs matching known suspicious patterns

items.name: Identify Outbound Traffic to Suspicious TLDs (Top-Level Domains)
items.value: _path=="http" AND tld in (list of suspicious TLDs) | count() by id.orig_h | sort -r
items.description: Detects outbound HTTP traffic to domains with suspicious or uncommon Top-Level Domains (TLDs)

items.name: Identify Outbound Traffic Using Long Domain Names
items.value: _path=="http" AND length(host) > 30 | count() by id.orig_h | sort -r
items.description: Detects outbound HTTP traffic to domains with unusually long names, which may indicate domain generation algorithms (DGAs) or obfuscation techniques

items.name: Identify Outbound Traffic to Known Phishing IP Addresses
items.value: _path=="conn" AND id.resp_h in (list of known phishing IP addresses) | count() by id.orig_h | sort -r
items.description: Detects outbound network traffic to IP addresses known to be associated with phishing campaigns

items.name: Identify Outbound Traffic to Rarely Accessed Ports
items.value: _path=="conn" AND id.resp_p in (list of rarely accessed ports) | count() by id.orig_h | sort -r
items.description: Detects outbound network traffic to ports that are rarely accessed or non-standard
